alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 12:46PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Street flooding in low lying and poorly drained areas caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parish, East Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Street flooding in low lying and poorly drained areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1246 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause street flooding in lying and poorly drained areas. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued street flooding issues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Merrydale and Baton Rouge Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
